question: The number of four digit even numbers that can be formed using the digits 0, 1, 2 and 3 without repetition is
explanation: For a number to be even, it must end in 0 or 2.
Case 1: Ends in 0. <katex>$_ _ _ 0$</katex>. Remaining 3 digits can be arranged in <katex>$3! = 6$</katex> ways.

Case 2: Ends in 2. <katex>$_ _ _ 2$</katex>. First digit cannot be 0. So first digit has 2 choices (1 or 3). Second digit has 2 choices (remaining + 0). Third has 1 choice. <katex>$2 \times 2 \times 1 = 4$</katex> ways.
